title: Philip Glass and Foday Musa Suso - Music from The Screens
description:
Music from The Screens

The Screens (Les Paravents) was Jean Genet&#039;s last play.  Political commentary, the context was the Algerian War, and there were riots in reaction to its performance in Paris in 1966. <a href=" http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Les_Paravents" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Les_Paravents</a>

This music was written by Glass and Suso as a collaborative effort for a 1989 performance. <a href=" http://www.philipglass.com/music/recordings/screens.php" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.philipglass.com/music/recordings/screens.php</a>

Recorded: 1992
Rip:  mp3 @ 320kbps

Music Composed by Philip Glass and Foday Musa Suso 
Music Director and Conductor: Martin Goldray 
Violin: Benjamin Hudson Flute and Piccolo: Michael Parloff 
Clarinet: Allen Blustine 
Cello: Jerry Grossman 
Keyboards: Martin Goldray 
Percussion: Rex Benincasa

1. The Mad Cadi&#039;s Court
2. Leila Dies
3. Said And His Shadow Dance
4. Decorating The Dummies
5. Warda&#039;s Whorehouse
6. The French Lieutenant Dreams
7. The Arab Women Lament
8. Land Of The Dead
9. Ansatou
10. 19th Century France
11. Said&#039;s Treason
12. The Orchard
13. The Village
14. Prison Song
15. Suso&#039;s Song
16. France
17. Night On The Balcony
18. North Africa - 1962
